qas.question: How did St. Anselm define the existence of God?

answers.text: "that than which nothing greater can be conceived"

qas.question: Who said that God is "a substance consisting of infinite attributes"?
What did Baruch Spinoza use as proof for the existence of God?

answers.text: a variation of the Ontological argument

qas.question: What did Spinoza believe the world was made of?

answers.text: one substance, God, or its equivalent, Nature

qas.question: Who defined god as "that than which nothing greater can be conceived"?
What was Spinoza's concept of God?
Spinoza believed that the universe was made up of one substance which is?
What does St. Anselm believe the universe is comprised of?

plausible_answers.text: a variation of the Ontological argument

qas.question: What does St. Anselm used to prove God's existence?
What does Baruch Spinoza believe nothing is greater than?
What kind of philosopher is St Anselm?
Who's idea about God did St. Anselm carry to its extreme?
